pt: {sc}alone{/sc} {sc}solitary{/sc} {sc}lonely{/sc} {sc}lonesome{/sc} {sc}lone{/sc} {sc}forlorn{/sc} {sc}desolate{/sc} mean isolated from others. {sc}alone{/sc} stresses the objective fact of being by oneself with slighter notion of emotional involvement than most of the remaining terms.
{sc}solitary{/sc} may indicate isolation as a chosen course

pt.t: glorying in the calm of her {it}solitary{/it} life

pt: but more often it suggests sadness and a sense of loss.

pt.t: left {it}solitary{/it} by the death of his wife

pt: {sc}lonely{/sc} adds to {sc}solitary{/sc} a suggestion of longing for companionship.
{sc}lonesome{/sc} heightens the suggestion of sadness and poignancy.

pt.t: an only child often leads a {it}lonesome{/it} life

pt: {sc}lone{/sc} may replace {sc}lonely{/sc} or {sc}lonesome{/sc} but typically is as objective as {sc}alone{/sc}.

pt.t: a {it}lone{/it} robin pecking at the lawn

pt: {sc}forlorn{/sc} stresses dejection, woe, and listlessness at separation from one held dear.
{sc}desolate{/sc} implies inconsolable grief at loss or bereavement.

shortdef: not frequented by human beings : desolate
